    65→class CitationGenerator(ABC, EventEmitter):

    74→class GraniteIOCitationGenerator(CitationGenerator):
    75→    """Simple sources listed in markdown."""
    76→
    77→    def __init__(self, openai_base_url: str, model_id: str, extra_headers: dict[str, str] | None = None) -> None:
    78→        super().__init__()
    79→        self.openai_base_url = openai_base_url
    80→        self.model_id = model_id
    81→        self.extra_headers = extra_headers
    82→        self.citations_io_processor = CitationsIOProcessor(
    83→            backend=make_backend(
    84→                "openai",
    85→                {
    86→                    "model_name": self.model_id,
    87→                    "openai_base_url": self.openai_base_url,
    88→                },
    89→            )
    90→        )
    91→
    92→    async def generate(self, docs: list[Document], response: str) -> None:
    93→        try:
    94→            sections = get_markdown_sections(response)
    95→            for section in sections:
    96→                if section.content.strip():
    97→                    async with task_pool.throttle():
    98→                        await self._generate_citations(docs, section)
    99→        except asyncio.CancelledError:
   100→            raise
   101→
   102→    async def _generate_citations(self, docs: list[Document], section: MarkdownSection) -> None:
   103→        try:
   104→            granite_io_messages = [GraniteIOAssistantMessage(content=section.content)]
   105→            granite_io_documents = [GraniteIODocument(doc_id=str(i), text=d.page_content) for i, d in enumerate(docs)]
   106→            doc_index = {str(i): d for i, d in enumerate(docs)}
   107→
   108→            async with chat_pool.throttle():
   109→                result = await self.citations_io_processor.acreate_chat_completion(
   110→                    ChatCompletionInputs(
   111→                        messages=granite_io_messages,
   112→                        documents=granite_io_documents,
   113→                        controls={"citations": True},
   114→                        generate_inputs=GenerateInputs(temperature=0.0, extra_headers=self.extra_headers),
   115→                    )
   116→                )
   117→
   118→            result = result.results[0].next_message
   119→
   120→            for gio_citation in result.citations:
   121→                if gio_citation.doc_id in doc_index:
   122→                    doc = doc_index[gio_citation.doc_id]
   123→
   124→                    # Any citation that contains markdown formatting or spans lines needs to be adjusted
   125→                    tokens = get_markdown_tokens_with_content(gio_citation.response_text)
   126→
   127→                    for tok in tokens:
   128→                        stripped = tok.content.strip()
   129→
   130→                        if stripped.endswith(":") or stripped.endswith("*") or not stripped.endswith("."):
   131→                            continue
   132→
   133→                        start_index = gio_citation.response_begin + section.start_index + tok.start_index
   134→                        end_index = gio_citation.response_begin + +section.start_index + tok.end_index
   135→
   136→                        await self._emit(
   137→                            CitationEvent(
   138→                                citation=Citation(
   139→                                    url=doc.metadata["url"],
   140→                                    title=doc.metadata["title"],
   141→                                    context_text=gio_citation.context_text,
   142→                                    start_index=start_index,
   143→                                    end_index=end_index,
   144→                                )
   145→                            )
   146→                        )
   147→
   148→        except Exception as e:  # Malformed citations throws error
   149→            logger.info(f"Failed to generate citations for `{section.content}`")
   150→            logger.exception(repr(e))
   151→
   152→
   153→def ensure_punkt() -> None:
   154→    try:
   155→        find(resource_name="tokenizers/punkt_tab")
   156→    except LookupError:
   157→        nltk.download(info_or_id="punkt_tab", quiet=True)
   158→
   159→
   160→class DefaultCitationGenerator(CitationGenerator):
   161→    """Simple sources listed in markdown."""
   162→
   163→    def __init__(self) -> None:
   164→        super().__init__()
   165→        ensure_punkt()
   166→        self.chat_model = ChatModelFactory.create("structured")
   167→
   168→    async def generate(self, docs: list[Document], response: str) -> None:
   169→        try:
   170→            sections = get_markdown_sections(response)
   171→            for section in sections:
   172→                if section.content.strip():
   173→                    async with task_pool.throttle():
   174→                        await self._generate_citations(docs, section)
   175→
   176→        except asyncio.CancelledError:
   177→            raise
   178→
   179→    async def _generate_citations(self, docs: list[Document], section: MarkdownSection) -> None:
   180→        try:
   181→            doc_index = {str(i): d for i, d in enumerate(docs)}
   182→            source_index = {d.metadata["source"]: d.metadata["title"] for d in docs}
   183→            tokens = get_markdown_tokens_with_content(section.content)
   184→            sentences = []
   185→            counter = count(start=0, step=1)
   186→            for tok in tokens:
   187→                stripped_content = tok.content.strip()
   188→                if tok.type == "inline" and stripped_content.endswith("."):
   189→                    sentences.extend(
   190→                        to_sentences(
   191→                            response=tok.content, offset=section.start_index + tok.start_index, counter=counter
   192→                        )
   193→                    )
   194→
   195→            sent_index: dict[str, Sentence] = {str(s.id): s for s in sentences}
   196→            prompt = CitationsPrompts.generate_citations_prompt(sentences=sentences, docs=docs)
   197→
   198→            async with chat_pool.throttle():
   199→                st_response = await self.chat_model.run(
   200→                    [UserMessage(content=prompt)],
   201→                    response_format=CitationsSchema,
   202→                )
   203→
   204→            assert isinstance(st_response.output_structured, CitationsSchema)
   205→            citations = st_response.output_structured
   206→
   207→            for cite in citations.citations:
   208→                if cite.sentence_id in sent_index and cite.source_id in doc_index:
   209→                    source = doc_index[cite.source_id].metadata["source"]
   210→                    if source in source_index:
   211→                        sentence = sent_index[cite.sentence_id]
   212→                        await self._emit(
   213→                            CitationEvent(
   214→                                citation=Citation(
   215→                                    url=source,
   216→                                    title=source_index[source],
   217→                                    context_text=cite.source_summary,
   218→                                    start_index=sentence.offset,
   219→                                    end_index=sentence.offset + sentence.length,
   220→                                )
   221→                            )
   222→                        )
   223→
   224→        except Exception as e:
   225→            logger.info(f"Failed to generate citations for `{section.content}`")
   226→            logger.exception(repr(e))
   227→
   228→
   229→class ReferencingMatchingCitationGenerator(CitationGenerator):
   230→    """Simple sources listed in markdown."""
   231→
   232→    def __init__(self) -> None:
   233→        super().__init__()
   234→        ensure_punkt()
   235→        self.chat_model = ChatModelFactory.create(model_type="structured")
   236→        self.embeddingsModel = EmbeddingsFactory.create(model_type="similarity")
   237→        self.sentence_splitter: PunktSentenceTokenizer = nltk.tokenize.punkt.PunktSentenceTokenizer()
   238→
   239→    async def generate(self, docs: list[Document], response: str) -> None:
   240→        try:
   241→            docs_as_sentences = [list(self.sentence_splitter.tokenize(d.page_content)) for d in docs]
   242→            docs_as_sentences_flat = [s for sub in docs_as_sentences for s in sub]
   243→
   244→            src_embeddings = await self.embeddingsModel.embeddings.aembed_documents(docs_as_sentences_flat)
   245→            np_src = np.atleast_2d(np.array(src_embeddings))
   246→
   247→            doc_sentence_offsets = [list(self.sentence_splitter.span_tokenize(d.page_content)) for d in docs]
   248→            flat_doc_sentence_offsets = [offset for offsets in doc_sentence_offsets for offset in offsets]
   249→            sentence_to_doc: list[int] = []
   250→
   251→            for doc_ix, doc_offsets in enumerate(doc_sentence_offsets):
   252→                sentence_to_doc = sentence_to_doc + ([doc_ix] * len(doc_offsets))
   253→
   254→            sections = get_markdown_sections(response)
   255→
   256→            for section in sections:
   257→                if section.content.strip():
   258→                    async with task_pool.throttle():
   259→                        counter = count(start=0, step=1)
   260→                        tokens = get_markdown_tokens_with_content(section.content)
   261→                        response_as_sentences: list[Sentence] = []
   262→                        for tok in tokens:
   263→                            stripped_content = tok.content.strip()
   264→                            if tok.type == "inline" and stripped_content.endswith("."):
   265→                                response_as_sentences.extend(
   266→                                    to_sentences(
   267→                                        response=tok.content,
   268→                                        offset=section.start_index + tok.start_index,
   269→                                        counter=counter,
   270→                                    )
   271→                                )
   272→
   273→                        if len(response_as_sentences):
   274→                            response_embeddings = await self.embeddingsModel.embeddings.aembed_documents(
   275→                                [s.text for s in response_as_sentences]
   276→                            )
   277→                            np_resp = np.atleast_2d(np.array(response_embeddings))
   278→                            sim_matrix = cosine_similarity(np_resp, np_src)
   279→                            top_n_indices = np.argsort(sim_matrix, axis=1)[:, -settings.CITATIONS_MAX_STATEMENTS :][
   280→                                :, ::-1
   281→                            ]  # sort descending
   282→                            top_n_scores = np.take_along_axis(sim_matrix, top_n_indices, axis=1)
   283→
   284→                            flat_unfiltered_indices = top_n_indices.flatten()
   285→                            flat_unfiltered_scores = top_n_scores.flatten()
   286→                            # Create a mask for scores above the threshold
   287→                            mask = flat_unfiltered_scores >= settings.CITATIONS_SIM_THRESHOLD
   288→
   289→                            # Apply the mask to both indices and scores
   290→                            flat_indices = flat_unfiltered_indices[mask]
   291→                            flat_scores = flat_unfiltered_scores[mask]
   292→
   293→                            # Sort flattened indices by score descending
   294→                            sorted_flat_indices = flat_indices[np.argsort(-flat_scores)]
   295→                            src_indices: set[int] = set(sorted_flat_indices.tolist())
   296→
   297→                            if len(src_indices):
   298→                                rewritten_docs = [f"<s{i}> {docs_as_sentences_flat[i]}" for i in src_indices]
   299→                                response_list = [f"<r{s.id}> {s.text}" for s in response_as_sentences]
   300→
   301→                                prompt = CitationsPrompts.generate_references_citations_prompt(
   302→                                    response=response_list, docs=rewritten_docs
   303→                                )
   304→
   305→                                async with chat_pool.throttle():
   306→                                    structured_output = await self.chat_model.run(
   307→                                        [UserMessage(content=prompt)],
   308→                                        response_format=ReferencingCitationsSchema,
   309→                                        max_retries=settings.MAX_RETRIES,
   310→                                    )
   311→
   312→                                assert isinstance(structured_output.output_structured, ReferencingCitationsSchema)
   313→                                citations = structured_output.output_structured
   314→
   315→                                message_sentence_offsets = [
   316→                                    (s.offset, s.offset + s.length) for s in response_as_sentences
   317→                                ]
   318→
   319→                                r_to_s: dict[int, set[int]] = defaultdict(set)
   320→
   321→                                for cite in citations.citations:
   322→                                    r_to_s[cite.r].add(cite.s)
   323→
   324→                                # for cite in citations.citations:
   325→                                for r, s_set in r_to_s.items():
   326→                                    if 0 <= r < len(message_sentence_offsets):
   327→                                        response_begin, response_end = message_sentence_offsets[r]
   328→
   329→                                        valid_indexes = [idx for idx in s_set if 0 <= idx < len(sentence_to_doc)]
   330→                                        citation_index_groups = group_consecutive_context_sentence_indexes(
   331→                                            valid_indexes, sentence_to_doc
   332→                                        )
   333→
   334→                                        for citation_index_group in citation_index_groups:
   335→                                            doc_num = sentence_to_doc[citation_index_group[0]]
   336→                                            context_begin, _ = flat_doc_sentence_offsets[citation_index_group[0]]
   337→                                            _, context_end = flat_doc_sentence_offsets[citation_index_group[1]]
   338→                                            context_text = docs[doc_num].page_content[context_begin:context_end]
   339→
   340→                                            await self._emit(
   341→                                                CitationEvent(
   342→                                                    citation=Citation(
   343→                                                        url=docs[doc_num].metadata["url"],
   344→                                                        title=docs[doc_num].metadata["title"],
   345→                                                        context_text=context_text,
   346→                                                        start_index=response_begin,
   347→                                                        end_index=response_end,
   348→                                                    )
   349→                                                )
   350→                                            )
   351→
   352→        except asyncio.CancelledError:
   353→            raise
   354→        except Exception as e:
   355→            logger.info(f"Failed to generate citations for `{response}`")
   356→            logger.exception(repr(e))
   357→
   358→
   359→def to_sentences(response: str, offset: int, counter: count) -> list[Sentence]:
   360→    sentences = sent_tokenize(response)
   361→    results = []
   362→    start = 0
   363→    for sentence in sentences:
   364→        start_index = response.find(sentence, start)
   365→        length = len(sentence)
   366→
   367→        results.append(Sentence(id=str(next(counter)), text=sentence, offset=offset + start_index, length=length))
   368→        start = start_index + length  # advance to avoid matching earlier sentence again
   369→
   370→    return results
   371→
   372→
   373→def group_consecutive_context_sentence_indexes(index_list: list[int], sentence_to_doc: list[int]) -> list[list[int]]:
   374→    """
   375→    Transform flat list of context sentence indexes into list of
   376→    context sentence index groups, where each group represents a set of
   377→    consecutive indexes from the same document in the original list.
   378→
   379→    A group is represented in the ouput as [x, y], where x and y are
   380→    the first and last context sentence indexes in the group, resp.
   381→
   382→    Example input:
   383→    [ 1, 3, 2, 5, 6, 8 ]
   384→
   385→    Example output:
   386→    (Assuming all indexes in the input correspond to sentences in the same doc)
   387→    [ [1, 3], [5, 6], [8, 8] ]
   388→
   389→    :param: List of context sentence indexes. The list should consist only
   390→            of unique indexes that also exist in the input documents
   391→    :param: Dictionary mapping sentence index to document index
   392→
   393→    :returns: List of sentence index groups, where each sentence index group
   394→    represents a set of consecutive indexes from the same document
   395→    in the input list
   396→    """
   397→    citation_indexes = sorted(index_list)
   398→    citation_index_groups = []
   399→
   400→    cur_group: list[int] = []
   401→    last_citation_index = -2
   402→    last_citation_index_doc = -2
   403→    for citation_index in citation_indexes:
   404→        if citation_index != last_citation_index + 1 or sentence_to_doc[citation_index] != last_citation_index_doc:
   405→            if len(cur_group) == 1:
   406→                cur_group.append(last_citation_index)
   407→                citation_index_groups.append(cur_group)
   408→            cur_group = [citation_index]
   409→        last_citation_index = citation_index
   410→        last_citation_index_doc = sentence_to_doc[citation_index]
   411→
   412→    if len(cur_group) == 1:
   413→        cur_group.append(citation_indexes[-1])
   414→        citation_index_groups.append(cur_group)
   415→
   416→    return citation_index_groups
   417→

# © Copyright IBM Corporation 2025
# SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0


import asyncio
from abc import ABC, abstractmethod
from collections import defaultdict
from itertools import count

import nltk
import numpy as np
from beeai_framework.backend import UserMessage
from granite_io import make_backend
from granite_io.io.citations import CitationsIOProcessor
from granite_io.types import AssistantMessage as GraniteIOAssistantMessage
from granite_io.types import ChatCompletionInputs, GenerateInputs
from granite_io.types import Document as GraniteIODocument
from langchain_core.documents import Document
from nltk.data import find
from nltk.tokenize import PunktSentenceTokenizer, sent_tokenize
from sklearn.metrics.pairwise import cosine_similarity

from granite_core import utils
from granite_core.chat_model import ChatModelFactory
from granite_core.citations.events import CitationEvent
from granite_core.citations.prompts import CitationsPrompts
from granite_core.citations.types import (
    Citation,
    CitationsSchema,
    ReferencingCitationsSchema,
    Sentence,
)
from granite_core.config import settings
from granite_core.emitter import EventEmitter
from granite_core.logging import get_logger
from granite_core.markdown import MarkdownSection, get_markdown_sections, get_markdown_tokens_with_content
from granite_core.search.embeddings.factory import EmbeddingsFactory
from granite_core.work import chat_pool, task_pool

logger = get_logger(__name__)


class CitationGeneratorFactory:
    """Factory for generating citations"""

    @staticmethod
    def create() -> "CitationGenerator":
        if settings.GRANITE_IO_OPENAI_API_BASE and settings.GRANITE_IO_CITATIONS_MODEL_ID:
            granite_io_openai_api_headers = utils.get_secret_value(settings.GRANITE_IO_OPENAI_API_HEADERS)
            extra_headers = (
                dict(pair.split("=", 1) for pair in granite_io_openai_api_headers.strip('"').split(","))
                if granite_io_openai_api_headers
                else None
            )

            return GraniteIOCitationGenerator(
                openai_base_url=str(settings.GRANITE_IO_OPENAI_API_BASE),
                model_id=settings.GRANITE_IO_CITATIONS_MODEL_ID,
                extra_headers=extra_headers,
            )
        else:
            return ReferencingMatchingCitationGenerator()


class CitationGenerator(ABC, EventEmitter):
    """Factory for generating citations"""

    @abstractmethod
    async def generate(self, docs: list[Document], response: str) -> None:
        """Generate citations"""
        pass


class GraniteIOCitationGenerator(CitationGenerator):
    """Simple sources listed in markdown."""

    def __init__(self, openai_base_url: str, model_id: str, extra_headers: dict[str, str] | None = None) -> None:
        super().__init__()
        self.openai_base_url = openai_base_url
        self.model_id = model_id
        self.extra_headers = extra_headers
        self.citations_io_processor = CitationsIOProcessor(
            backend=make_backend(
                "openai",
                {
                    "model_name": self.model_id,
                    "openai_base_url": self.openai_base_url,
                },
            )
        )

    async def generate(self, docs: list[Document], response: str) -> None:
        try:
            sections = get_markdown_sections(response)
            for section in sections:
                if section.content.strip():
                    async with task_pool.throttle():
                        await self._generate_citations(docs, section)
        except asyncio.CancelledError:
            raise

    async def _generate_citations(self, docs: list[Document], section: MarkdownSection) -> None:
        try:
            granite_io_messages = [GraniteIOAssistantMessage(content=section.content)]
            granite_io_documents = [GraniteIODocument(doc_id=str(i), text=d.page_content) for i, d in enumerate(docs)]
            doc_index = {str(i): d for i, d in enumerate(docs)}

            async with chat_pool.throttle():
                result = await self.citations_io_processor.acreate_chat_completion(
                    ChatCompletionInputs(
                        messages=granite_io_messages,
                        documents=granite_io_documents,
                        controls={"citations": True},
                        generate_inputs=GenerateInputs(temperature=0.0, extra_headers=self.extra_headers),
                    )
                )

            result = result.results[0].next_message

            for gio_citation in result.citations:
                if gio_citation.doc_id in doc_index:
                    doc = doc_index[gio_citation.doc_id]

                    # Any citation that contains markdown formatting or spans lines needs to be adjusted
                    tokens = get_markdown_tokens_with_content(gio_citation.response_text)

                    for tok in tokens:
                        stripped = tok.content.strip()

                        if stripped.endswith(":") or stripped.endswith("*") or not stripped.endswith("."):
                            continue

                        start_index = gio_citation.response_begin + section.start_index + tok.start_index
                        end_index = gio_citation.response_begin + +section.start_index + tok.end_index

                        await self._emit(
                            CitationEvent(
                                citation=Citation(
                                    url=doc.metadata["url"],
                                    title=doc.metadata["title"],
                                    context_text=gio_citation.context_text,
                                    start_index=start_index,
                                    end_index=end_index,
                                )
                            )
                        )

        except Exception as e:  # Malformed citations throws error
            logger.info(f"Failed to generate citations for `{section.content}`")
            logger.exception(repr(e))


def ensure_punkt() -> None:
    try:
        find(resource_name="tokenizers/punkt_tab")
    except LookupError:
        nltk.download(info_or_id="punkt_tab", quiet=True)


class DefaultCitationGenerator(CitationGenerator):
    """Simple sources listed in markdown."""

    def __init__(self) -> None:
        super().__init__()
        ensure_punkt()
        self.chat_model = ChatModelFactory.create("structured")

    async def generate(self, docs: list[Document], response: str) -> None:
        try:
            sections = get_markdown_sections(response)
            for section in sections:
                if section.content.strip():
                    async with task_pool.throttle():
                        await self._generate_citations(docs, section)

        except asyncio.CancelledError:
            raise

    async def _generate_citations(self, docs: list[Document], section: MarkdownSection) -> None:
        try:
            doc_index = {str(i): d for i, d in enumerate(docs)}
            source_index = {d.metadata["source"]: d.metadata["title"] for d in docs}
            tokens = get_markdown_tokens_with_content(section.content)
            sentences = []
            counter = count(start=0, step=1)
            for tok in tokens:
                stripped_content = tok.content.strip()
                if tok.type == "inline" and stripped_content.endswith("."):
                    sentences.extend(
                        to_sentences(
                            response=tok.content, offset=section.start_index + tok.start_index, counter=counter
                        )
                    )

            sent_index: dict[str, Sentence] = {str(s.id): s for s in sentences}
            prompt = CitationsPrompts.generate_citations_prompt(sentences=sentences, docs=docs)

            async with chat_pool.throttle():
                st_response = await self.chat_model.run(
                    [UserMessage(content=prompt)],
                    response_format=CitationsSchema,
                )

            assert isinstance(st_response.output_structured, CitationsSchema)
            citations = st_response.output_structured

            for cite in citations.citations:
                if cite.sentence_id in sent_index and cite.source_id in doc_index:
                    source = doc_index[cite.source_id].metadata["source"]
                    if source in source_index:
                        sentence = sent_index[cite.sentence_id]
                        await self._emit(
                            CitationEvent(
                                citation=Citation(
                                    url=source,
                                    title=source_index[source],
                                    context_text=cite.source_summary,
                                    start_index=sentence.offset,
                                    end_index=sentence.offset + sentence.length,
                                )
                            )
                        )

        except Exception as e:
            logger.info(f"Failed to generate citations for `{section.content}`")
            logger.exception(repr(e))


class ReferencingMatchingCitationGenerator(CitationGenerator):
    """Simple sources listed in markdown."""

    def __init__(self) -> None:
        super().__init__()
        ensure_punkt()
        self.chat_model = ChatModelFactory.create(model_type="structured")
        self.embeddingsModel = EmbeddingsFactory.create(model_type="similarity")
        self.sentence_splitter: PunktSentenceTokenizer = nltk.tokenize.punkt.PunktSentenceTokenizer()

    async def generate(self, docs: list[Document], response: str) -> None:
        try:
            docs_as_sentences = [list(self.sentence_splitter.tokenize(d.page_content)) for d in docs]
            docs_as_sentences_flat = [s for sub in docs_as_sentences for s in sub]

            src_embeddings = await self.embeddingsModel.embeddings.aembed_documents(docs_as_sentences_flat)
            np_src = np.atleast_2d(np.array(src_embeddings))

            doc_sentence_offsets = [list(self.sentence_splitter.span_tokenize(d.page_content)) for d in docs]
            flat_doc_sentence_offsets = [offset for offsets in doc_sentence_offsets for offset in offsets]
            sentence_to_doc: list[int] = []

            for doc_ix, doc_offsets in enumerate(doc_sentence_offsets):
                sentence_to_doc = sentence_to_doc + ([doc_ix] * len(doc_offsets))

            sections = get_markdown_sections(response)

            for section in sections:
                if section.content.strip():
                    async with task_pool.throttle():
                        counter = count(start=0, step=1)
                        tokens = get_markdown_tokens_with_content(section.content)
                        response_as_sentences: list[Sentence] = []
                        for tok in tokens:
                            stripped_content = tok.content.strip()
                            if tok.type == "inline" and stripped_content.endswith("."):
                                response_as_sentences.extend(
                                    to_sentences(
                                        response=tok.content,
                                        offset=section.start_index + tok.start_index,
                                        counter=counter,
                                    )
                                )

                        if len(response_as_sentences):
                            response_embeddings = await self.embeddingsModel.embeddings.aembed_documents(
                                [s.text for s in response_as_sentences]
                            )
                            np_resp = np.atleast_2d(np.array(response_embeddings))
                            sim_matrix = cosine_similarity(np_resp, np_src)
                            top_n_indices = np.argsort(sim_matrix, axis=1)[:, -settings.CITATIONS_MAX_STATEMENTS :][
                                :, ::-1
                            ]  # sort descending
                            top_n_scores = np.take_along_axis(sim_matrix, top_n_indices, axis=1)

                            flat_unfiltered_indices = top_n_indices.flatten()
                            flat_unfiltered_scores = top_n_scores.flatten()
                            # Create a mask for scores above the threshold
                            mask = flat_unfiltered_scores >= settings.CITATIONS_SIM_THRESHOLD

                            # Apply the mask to both indices and scores
                            flat_indices = flat_unfiltered_indices[mask]
                            flat_scores = flat_unfiltered_scores[mask]

                            # Sort flattened indices by score descending
                            sorted_flat_indices = flat_indices[np.argsort(-flat_scores)]
                            src_indices: set[int] = set(sorted_flat_indices.tolist())

                            if len(src_indices):
                                rewritten_docs = [f"<s{i}> {docs_as_sentences_flat[i]}" for i in src_indices]
                                response_list = [f"<r{s.id}> {s.text}" for s in response_as_sentences]

                                prompt = CitationsPrompts.generate_references_citations_prompt(
                                    response=response_list, docs=rewritten_docs
                                )

                                async with chat_pool.throttle():
                                    structured_output = await self.chat_model.run(
                                        [UserMessage(content=prompt)],
                                        response_format=ReferencingCitationsSchema,
                                        max_retries=settings.MAX_RETRIES,
                                    )

                                assert isinstance(structured_output.output_structured, ReferencingCitationsSchema)
                                citations = structured_output.output_structured

                                message_sentence_offsets = [
                                    (s.offset, s.offset + s.length) for s in response_as_sentences
                                ]

                                r_to_s: dict[int, set[int]] = defaultdict(set)

                                for cite in citations.citations:
                                    r_to_s[cite.r].add(cite.s)

                                # for cite in citations.citations:
                                for r, s_set in r_to_s.items():
                                    if 0 <= r < len(message_sentence_offsets):
                                        response_begin, response_end = message_sentence_offsets[r]

                                        valid_indexes = [idx for idx in s_set if 0 <= idx < len(sentence_to_doc)]
                                        citation_index_groups = group_consecutive_context_sentence_indexes(
                                            valid_indexes, sentence_to_doc
                                        )

                                        for citation_index_group in citation_index_groups:
                                            doc_num = sentence_to_doc[citation_index_group[0]]
                                            context_begin, _ = flat_doc_sentence_offsets[citation_index_group[0]]
                                            _, context_end = flat_doc_sentence_offsets[citation_index_group[1]]
                                            context_text = docs[doc_num].page_content[context_begin:context_end]

                                            await self._emit(
                                                CitationEvent(
                                                    citation=Citation(
                                                        url=docs[doc_num].metadata["url"],
                                                        title=docs[doc_num].metadata["title"],
                                                        context_text=context_text,
                                                        start_index=response_begin,
                                                        end_index=response_end,
                                                    )
                                                )
                                            )

        except asyncio.CancelledError:
            raise
        except Exception as e:
            logger.info(f"Failed to generate citations for `{response}`")
            logger.exception(repr(e))


def to_sentences(response: str, offset: int, counter: count) -> list[Sentence]:
    sentences = sent_tokenize(response)
    results = []
    start = 0
    for sentence in sentences:
        start_index = response.find(sentence, start)
        length = len(sentence)

        results.append(Sentence(id=str(next(counter)), text=sentence, offset=offset + start_index, length=length))
        start = start_index + length  # advance to avoid matching earlier sentence again

    return results


def group_consecutive_context_sentence_indexes(index_list: list[int], sentence_to_doc: list[int]) -> list[list[int]]:
    """
    Transform flat list of context sentence indexes into list of
    context sentence index groups, where each group represents a set of
    consecutive indexes from the same document in the original list.

    A group is represented in the ouput as [x, y], where x and y are
    the first and last context sentence indexes in the group, resp.

    Example input:
    [ 1, 3, 2, 5, 6, 8 ]

    Example output:
    (Assuming all indexes in the input correspond to sentences in the same doc)
    [ [1, 3], [5, 6], [8, 8] ]

    :param: List of context sentence indexes. The list should consist only
            of unique indexes that also exist in the input documents
    :param: Dictionary mapping sentence index to document index

    :returns: List of sentence index groups, where each sentence index group
    represents a set of consecutive indexes from the same document
    in the input list
    """
    citation_indexes = sorted(index_list)
    citation_index_groups = []

    cur_group: list[int] = []
    last_citation_index = -2
    last_citation_index_doc = -2
    for citation_index in citation_indexes:
        if citation_index != last_citation_index + 1 or sentence_to_doc[citation_index] != last_citation_index_doc:
            if len(cur_group) == 1:
                cur_group.append(last_citation_index)
                citation_index_groups.append(cur_group)
            cur_group = [citation_index]
        last_citation_index = citation_index
        last_citation_index_doc = sentence_to_doc[citation_index]

    if len(cur_group) == 1:
        cur_group.append(citation_indexes[-1])
        citation_index_groups.append(cur_group)

    return citation_index_groups

content.text:
Yes, the lazy loading approach at line 153-157 looks correct. The `ensure_punkt()` function:

1. **Checks if punkt_tab exists** using `find(resource_name="tokenizers/punkt_tab")` 
2. **Only downloads if needed** - catches the `LookupError` exception when the resource isn't found
3. **Is called during initialization** - invoked in `__init__` methods of `DefaultCitationGenerator` (line 165) and `ReferencingMatchingCitationGenerator` (line 234)

This is a proper lazy loading pattern because:
- The download only happens once, when the class is first instantiated
- It avoids downloading during module import (which would slow down startup)
- It ensures the resource is available before it's needed at runtime
- The `quiet=True` flag prevents noisy download output

The implementation matches the pattern you'd want for the `punkt_tab` tokenizer. Is there a specific issue you're encountering with it?

# Base
FROM registry.access.redhat.com/ubi10-minimal AS base

WORKDIR /app
USER root

ENV PATH="/app/.venv/bin:$PATH" \
    HOME=/tmp

COPY --from=ghcr.io/astral-sh/uv:0.9.2 /uv /bin/
RUN rpm -ivh https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/epel-release-latest-10.noarch.rpm && \
    microdnf -y install python3.13

# Build
FROM base AS builder

COPY granite_core /app/granite_core
COPY acp /app/acp

RUN microdnf -y install git && \
    uv --directory acp --no-managed-python sync --no-dev --no-cache --locked --link-mode copy --no-editable && \
    uv --directory acp run --no-sync python -m nltk.downloader punkt_tab -d /app/acp/nltk_data

# Run
FROM base AS runner

USER 1001
ENV NLTK_DATA=/app/nltk_data

COPY --from=builder --chown=1001:1001 /app/acp /app

CMD ["uv", "run", "--no-sync", "-m", "acp_agent.agent"]

# Base
FROM registry.access.redhat.com/ubi10-minimal AS base

WORKDIR /app
USER root

ENV PATH="/app/.venv/bin:$PATH" \
    HOME=/tmp

COPY --from=ghcr.io/astral-sh/uv:0.9.2 /uv /bin/
RUN rpm -ivh https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/epel-release-latest-10.noarch.rpm && \
    microdnf -y install python3.13

# Build
FROM base AS builder

COPY granite_core /app/granite_core
COPY a2a /app/a2a

RUN uv --directory a2a --no-managed-python sync --no-dev --no-cache --locked --link-mode copy --no-editable

# Run
FROM base AS runner

USER 1001

COPY --from=builder --chown=1001:1001 /app/a2a /app

CMD ["uv", "run", "--no-sync", "-m", "a2a_agents.agents.chat.agent_chat"]

content.text:
Done! I've updated all four a2a Dockerfiles to include the punkt_tab download in the builder stage:

- `a2a/Dockerfiles/agent/Dockerfile`
- `a2a/Dockerfiles/agent_research/Dockerfile`
- `a2a/Dockerfiles/agent_search/Dockerfile`
- `a2a/Dockerfiles/agent_chat/Dockerfile`

Each now downloads punkt_tab to `/app/a2a/nltk_data` in the same way as the acp/Dockerfile does it.

message.content: dont you also need to set the nltk data flah in the runner?

content.thinking:
The user is asking if I need to set the NLTK_DATA environment variable in the runner stage, similar to how it's done in the acp/Dockerfile. Let me check the acp/Dockerfile again:

Looking at the acp/Dockerfile:
```
# Run
FROM base AS runner

USER 1001
ENV NLTK_DATA=/app/nltk_data

COPY --from=builder --chown=1001:1001 /app/acp /app

CMD ["uv", "run", "--no-sync", "-m", "acp_agent.agent"]
```

Yes! It has `ENV NLTK_DATA=/app/nltk_data` in the runner stage.

But the a2a Dockerfiles currently don't have this. They just have:
```
# Run
FROM base AS runner

USER 1001

COPY --from=builder --chown=1001:1001 /app/a2a /app

CMD ["uv", "run", "--no-sync", "-m", ..."]
```

So yes, I should add the `ENV NLTK_DATA=/app/a2a/nltk_data` line to each runner stage. The user is correct.

file.content:
# Base
FROM registry.access.redhat.com/ubi10-minimal AS base

WORKDIR /app
USER root

ENV PATH="/app/.venv/bin:$PATH" \
    HOME=/tmp

COPY --from=ghcr.io/astral-sh/uv:0.9.2 /uv /bin/
RUN rpm -ivh https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/epel-release-latest-10.noarch.rpm && \
    microdnf -y install python3.13

# Build
FROM base AS builder

COPY granite_core /app/granite_core
COPY acp /app/acp

RUN microdnf -y install git && \
    uv --directory acp --no-managed-python sync --no-dev --no-cache --locked --link-mode copy --no-editable && \
    uv --directory acp run --no-sync python -m nltk.downloader punkt_tab -d /app/acp/nltk_data

# Run
FROM base AS runner

USER 1001
ENV NLTK_DATA=/app/nltk_data

COPY --from=builder --chown=1001:1001 /app/acp /app

CMD ["uv", "run", "--no-sync", "-m", "acp_agent.agent"]

content.text:
Ah I see! In the acp/Dockerfile, the NLTK_DATA is set to `/app/nltk_data` (line 28), not `/app/acp/nltk_data`. But the download goes to `/app/acp/nltk_data` (line 22). 

Looking at line 30, it copies `/app/acp` to `/app`, so the nltk_data ends up at `/app/nltk_data` in the runtime container. So for the a2a Dockerfiles, the ENV should be `/app/nltk_data` as well. Let me update with the correct path:

ENV NLTK_DATA=/app/nltk_data
